data.text: 3-Ketoacyl thiolase delays aging ofCaenorhabditis elegansand is required for lifespan extension mediated bysir-2.1 Abstracts of papers presented at the 1985 meeting on C. elegans, May 15-May 19, 1985: Biomedical consulting agreements, c2012: The lin-11 LIM domain transcription factor is necessary for morphogenesis of C. elegans uterine cells The lin-14 locus of Caenorhabditis elegans controls the time of expression of specific postembryonic developmental events The LIN-15A and LIN-56 transcriptional regulators interact to negatively regulate EGF/Ras signaling in Caenorhabditis elegans vulval cell-fate determination lin-17 mutations of Caenorhabditis elegans disrupt certain asymmetric cell divisions. lin-35 and lin-53, two genes that antagonize a C. elegans Ras pathway, encode proteins similar to Rb and its binding protein RbAp48. The lin-41 RBCC gene acts in the C. elegans heterochronic pathway between the let-7 regulatory RNA and the LIN-29 transcription factor LIN-61, one of two Caenorhabditis elegans malignant-brain-tumor-repeat-containing proteins, acts with the DRM and NuRD-like protein complexes in vulval development but not in certain other biological processes lin-8, which antagonizes Caenorhabditis elegans Ras-mediated vulval induction, encodes a novel nuclear protein that interacts with the LIN-35 Rb protein Linkage of familial amyotrophic lateral sclerosis with frontotemporal dementia to chromosome 9q21-q22 A locus on chromosome 9p confers susceptibility to ALS and frontotemporal dementia MAB-10/NAB acts with LIN-29/EGR to regulate terminal differentiation and the transition from larva to adult in C. elegans Mechanisms of asymmetric cell division: Two Bs or not two Bs, that is the question Members of the miRNA-200 family regulate olfactory neurogenesis Microarray analysis of microRNA expression in the developing mammalian brain Migrations of the Caenorhabditis elegans HSNs are regulated by egl-43, a gene encoding two zinc finger proteins MOD-1 is a serotonin-gated chloride channel that modulates locomotory behaviour in C. elegans Une mort programmeÌe, francÌ§ais Most Caenorhabditis elegans microRNAs are individually not essential for development or viability Mutations in synaptojanin disrupt synaptic vesicle recycling Mutations in the alpha1 subunit of an L-type voltage-activated Ca2+ channel cause myotonia in Caenorhabditis elegans Mutations in the glutamate transporter EAAT2 gene do not cause abnormal EAAT2 transcripts in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis Mutations that lead to reiterations in the cell lineages of C. elegans Nematode postembryonic cell lineages. A neuronal acetylcholine receptor regulates the balance of muscle excitation and inhibition in Caenorhabditis elegans A new class of C. elegans synMuv genes implicates a Tip60/NuA4-like HAT complex as a negative regulator of Ras signaling No association ofDYNC1H1with sporadic ALS in a caseâcontrol study of a northern European derived population: A tagging SNP approach Novel cysteine-rich motif and homeodomain in the product of the Caenorhabditis elegans cell lineage gene lin-11. A novel dominant transformer allele of the sex-determining gene her-1 of Caenorhabditis elegans NUC-1, a caenorhabditis elegans DNase II homolog, functions in an intermediate step of DNA degradation during apoptosis Obituary: Stanley J. Korsmeyer (1950-2005). Odorant-selective genes and neurons mediate olfaction in C. elegans. PAG-3, a Zn-finger transcription factor, determines neuroblast fate in C. elegans. Patterning of the Caenorhabditis elegans head region by the Pax-6 family member vab-3. Pharyngeal pumping continues after laser killing of the pharyngeal nervous system of C. elegans Phosphorylation of IkappaB-alpha inhibits its cleavage by caspase CPP32 in vitro Polypeptide Bound to the Host RNA Polymerase is Specified by T4 Control Gene 33 Presumptive TRP channel CED-11 promotes cell volume decrease and facilitates degradation of apoptotic cells in Caenorhabditis elegans Programmed elimination of cells by caspase-independent cell extrusion in C. elegans Receptor-type guanylate cyclase is required for carbon dioxide sensation by Caenorhabditis elegans Reduced expression of the Kinesin-Associated Protein 3 (KIFAP3) gene increases survival in sporadic amyotrophic lateral sclerosis Refined mapping and characterization of the recessive familial amyotrophic lateral sclerosis locus (ALS2) on chromosome 2q33 Regulation of nicotinic receptor trafficking by the transmembrane Golgi protein UNC-50. Replication-coupled chromatin assembly generates a neuronal bilateral asymmetry in C. elegans Replication stress promotes cell elimination by extrusion Robert Horvitz - esence Serotonin and octopamine in the nematode Caenorhabditis elegans The short coiled-coil domain-containing protein UNC-69 cooperates with UNC-76 to regulate axonal outgrowth and normal presynaptic organization in Caenorhabditis elegans Signal transduction during C. elegans vulval induction SLI-1 Cbl inhibits the engulfment of apoptotic cells in C. elegans through a ligase-independent function Some C. elegans class B synthetic multivulva proteins encode a conserved LIN-35 Rb-containing complex distinct from a NuRD-like complex An Sp1 transcription factor coordinates caspase-dependent and -independent apoptotic pathways SPK-1, an SR protein kinase, inhibits programmed cell death in Caenorhabditis elegans The SQV-1 UDP-glucuronic acid decarboxylase and the SQV-7 nucleotide-sugar transporter may act in the Golgi apparatus to affect Caenorhabditis elegans vulval morphogenesis and embryonic development Superoxide dismutase concentration and activity in familial amyotrophic lateral sclerosis Tc4, a Caenorhabditis elegans transposable element with an unusual fold-back structure The TRA-1A sex determination protein of C. elegans regulates sexually dimorphic cell deaths by repressing the egl-1 cell death activator gene The translational regulators GCN-1 and ABCF-3 act together to promote apoptosis in C. elegans Translocation of C. elegans CED-4 to nuclear membranes during programmed cell death US immigration order strikes against biotech. Variants of the elongator protein 3 (ELP3) gene are associated with motor neuron degeneration Wnt and EGF pathways act together to induce C. elegans male hook development Worms, life, and death (Nobel lecture). Xk-related protein 8 and CED-8 promote phosphatidylserine exposure in apoptotic cells
